content:
You’ve just been seated at your favorite Las Vegas buffet. You have $90$ minutes to eat your money’s worth by scarfing down as many plates of food and dessert as you possibly can.

It takes you $3$ minutes to eat a plate of food. You can eat a plate of dessert in $2$ minutes.

**Write an *inequality* that represents the number of food plates $(F)$ and dessert plates $(D)$ you can finish within the time limit.** 

[[☃ expression 1]]

**Graph the constraint equation with $F$ on the horizontal axis and $D$ on the vertical axis.** 

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

**If you eat $20$ plates of food $(F)$, which of the following numbers of dessert plates $(D)$ can you have without exceeding the time limit and being dragged away by restaurant security?** 

[[☃ radio 1]]
